pullRequest.body:
A few more lemmas about division and order/distributivity in EReal.

---

* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>

bors merge

Thanks!

maintainer merge
These are great, but I went down a rabbit hole with one of them. You are welcome to push back on my comments if you think they go too far.

Thanks!

maintainer merge

Thanks :tada:

bors merge

I think it makes sense to generalize this further than `0 < b`; one approach is:
```lean
protected lemma div_neg {a b : EReal} : a / -b = -(a / b) := by
  rw [div_eq_mul_inv _ b, mul_comm, ← EReal.neg_mul, mul_comm, ← inv_neg, ← div_eq_mul_inv]

lemma div_eq_iff {a b c : EReal} (hbot : b ≠ ⊥) (htop : b ≠ ⊤) (hzero : b ≠ 0) :
    c / b = a ↔ c = a * b := by
  nth_rw 1 [← @mul_div_cancel a b hbot htop hzero]
  rw [mul_div b a b, mul_comm a b]
  refine ⟨fun h₀ ↦ ?_, fun h₀ ↦ h₀ ▸ rfl⟩
  cases hzero.lt_or_lt with
  | inl hneg =>
    rw [← neg_zero, EReal.lt_neg_comm] at hneg
    rw [Ne, ← neg_eq_top_iff] at hbot
    have := (strictMono_div_right_of_pos hneg hbot)
    rwa [← this.injective.eq_iff, ← neg_inj, ← EReal.div_neg, ← EReal.div_neg, neg_neg]
  | inr hpos => exact (strictMono_div_right_of_pos hpos htop).injective h₀
```
though perhaps a more principled approach than using the order properties could be
```lean
lemma mul_right_coe_inj {a c : EReal} {b : ℝ} (hzero : b ≠ 0) : a * b = c * b ↔ a = c := by
  cases a with
  | h_bot =>
    cases hzero.lt_or_lt with
    | inl h =>
        rw [bot_mul_coe_of_neg, eq_comm, mul_eq_top]
        simp_all [h.not_lt, eq_comm]
        simp_all
    | inr h =>
        rw [bot_mul_coe_of_pos, eq_comm, mul_eq_bot]
        simp_all [h.not_lt, eq_comm]
        simp_all
  | h_real a =>
    cases c with
    | h_bot =>
      simp [← coe_mul]
      cases hzero.lt_or_lt with
      | inl h =>
          rw [bot_mul_coe_of_neg]
          simp_all [-coe_mul]
          simp_all
      | inr h =>
          rw [bot_mul_coe_of_pos]
          simp_all [-coe_mul]
          simp_all
    | h_real a =>
      simp_all [← coe_mul]
    | h_top =>
      simp [← coe_mul]
      cases hzero.lt_or_lt with
      | inl h =>
          rw [top_mul_coe_of_neg]
          simp_all [-coe_mul]
          simp_all
      | inr h =>
          rw [top_mul_coe_of_pos]
          simp_all [-coe_mul]
          simp_all
  | h_top =>
    cases hzero.lt_or_lt with
    | inl h =>
        rw [top_mul_coe_of_neg, eq_comm, mul_eq_bot]
        simp_all [h.not_lt, eq_comm]
        simp_all
    | inr h =>
        rw [top_mul_coe_of_pos, eq_comm, mul_eq_top]
        simp_all [h.not_lt, eq_comm]
        simp_all

protected lemma mul_right_inj {a b c : EReal} (hbot : b ≠ ⊥) (htop : b ≠ ⊤) (hzero : b ≠ 0) : a * b = c * b ↔ a = c := by
  lift b to ℝ using ⟨htop, hbot⟩
  rw [mul_right_coe_inj]
  simp_all

lemma inv_mul_coe_cancel_right {a : EReal} {b : ℝ} (hzero : b ≠ 0) : a * b⁻¹ * b = a := by
  rw [mul_assoc, ← coe_mul, inv_mul_cancel₀ hzero, coe_one, mul_one]

protected lemma inv_mul_cancel_right {a b : EReal} (hbot : b ≠ ⊥) (htop : b ≠ ⊤) (hzero : b ≠ 0) : a * b⁻¹ * b = a := by
  lift b to ℝ using ⟨htop, hbot⟩
  rw [← coe_inv, inv_mul_coe_cancel_right]
  simp_all

lemma div_eq_iff' {a b c : EReal} (hbot : b ≠ ⊥) (htop : b ≠ ⊤) (hzero : b ≠ 0) :
    c / b = a ↔ c = a * b := by
  rw [div_eq_mul_inv, ← EReal.mul_right_inj hbot htop hzero, EReal.inv_mul_cancel_right hbot htop hzero]
```
(I'm hoping there's a better proof for `mul_right_coe_inj`)

Thanks for this very fruitful remark!

In the end, I did it completely differently, but I managed to generalize this lemma, move it one section before (so without using the order properties) and the new proof is much simpler.
This is misnamed; all other lemmas with this conclusion are named `add_div`. Don't change that in this PR, though.
That's noted for a further (short) PR. Thanks for the remark!

However, we should immediately pick a better name here. My first thought was `add_div_of_nonneg_right`, though other lemmas (e.g. `Nat.add_div_of_dvd_right`) use "right" to refer to b rather than c. Probably still better than `_by_`; we never seem to use that to refer to a denominator

`add_div_of_nonneg_right` looks good. The library is a bit inconsistent with the left/right designation; here I'd prefer right.

(the `by` was because `div_right_distrib_of_nonneg` was already taken. But your remark solves this problem)
I think `cases` is more sensible than `induction` here, since there's no induction hypothesis anywhere
Done. I've also changed `induction` for `cases` in the other occurrences around this lemma. That said, this file is rife with this.

pullRequest.title: feat(Data.Real.EReal): add lemmas about division
